instruction:
Language Arts

This section of the test contains multiple-choice questions, which you must answer by using your computer mouse to select the correct response. Upon answering a question, you can go to the next question by clicking the Next button on the Menu bar.

During this section of the test, if you choose you may skip an item and then later return to that item.

When you are finished, select Submit from the Menu bar. Your Test Administrator may have set a time limit for this test section. If there is a time limit, you will be told how much time you have. If a time limit has been set for this section of the test, you will notice a countdown timer on the Header of the screen, showing the amount of time remaining to complete this section of the test.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences capitalizes the appropriate words correctly?

options.text: Bank holidays like thanksgiving are inconvenient; consumers cannot take out loans on these days.
Bank holidays like Thanksgiving are inconvenient; consumers cannot take out loans on these days.
Bank holidays like Thanksgiving are inconvenient; Consumers cannot take out loans on these days.
Bank holidays like thanksgiving are inconvenient; Consumers cannot take out loans on these days.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences capitalizes the appropriate words correctly?

options.text: Taking the Amtrak train through the town of Mount Shasta is an eerie experience.
Taking the Amtrak train through the town of mount Shasta is an eerie experience.
Taking the amtrak train through the town of Mount Shasta is an eerie experience.
Taking the amtrak train through the town of mount Shasta is an eerie experience.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences capitalizes the appropriate words correctly?

options.text: We were told by Director Smith to submit our application directly to the Human Resources Manager.
We were told by Director Smith to submit our application directly to the human resources manager.
We were told by director Smith to submit our application directly to the human resources manager.
We were told by director Smith to submit our application directly to the Human Resources Manager.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences capitalizes the appropriate words correctly?

options.text: The Forest Ranger at Lakeside Park will be enforcing park rules and regulations.
The Forest Ranger at Lakeside park will be enforcing park rules and regulations.
The forest ranger at Lakeside park will be enforcing park rules and regulations.
The forest ranger at Lakeside Park will be enforcing park rules and regulations.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences capitalizes the appropriate words correctly?

options.text: According to the FBI warning, you cannot make a copy of the movie Pazow .
According to the fbi warning, you cannot make a copy of the movie Pazow .
According to the FBI warning, you cannot make a copy of the movie pazow .
According to the fbi warning, you cannot make a copy of the movie pazow .

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences capitalizes the appropriate words correctly?

options.text: The book The Life and Times of Me and You was written by Ms. Fangle.
The book The Life and Times of Me and You was written by ms. Fangle.
The book the Life and Times of Me and You was written by Ms. Fangle.
The book the Life and Times of Me and You was written by ms. Fangle.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences capitalizes the appropriate words correctly?

options.text: The new x-ray machine will be set up in the hospital on North street.
The new X-ray machine will be set up in the hospital on North Street.
The new x-ray machine will be set up in the hospital on North Street.
The new X-ray machine will be set up in the hospital on North street.

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in parenthesis best fills in the blank?

The runner (pace) ___________ himself in order to complete yesterday's marathon.

options.text: paces
pacing
paced
pace

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in parenthesis best fills in the blank?

The last coach we had (teach) _________ the team not only how to play the game, but to be better people too.

options.text: teaches
teach
taught
teaching

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in parenthesis best fills in the blank?

How will you be (pay) ___________ for tonight's dinner?

options.text: pay
paying
paid
pays

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in the parentheses best fills in the blank?

I can't hear what you are (say) _____ because it is loud at the airport.

options.text: said
says
have said
saying

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in the parentheses best fills in the blank?

Everyone love's Michael's designs; they (be) ____ well thought of in the architectural community.

options.text: be
is
are
being

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in the parentheses best fills in the blank?

I think Mr. Henderson has (forget) _____ that we're ready to see him.

options.text: forgot
forgotten
forget
forgetting

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in the parentheses best fills in the blank?

I (try) ____ to remember her name, but it was difficult.

options.text: tries
try
trying
tried

questions.questionText:
Which tense of the verb in the parentheses best fills in the blank?

To stay healthy, Mark (swim) ______ 20 laps in the pool every day.

options.text: swims
swim
swimming
swam

questions.questionText: Which of the following punctuation marks is used to end a statement?

options.text: A period
A semicolon
A question mark
A colon

questions.questionText: Which of the following punctuation marks is used after an abbreviation?

options.text: A period
A comma
An exclamation mark
A hyphen

questions.questionText: Which of the following punctuation marks is used to signify a spoken phrase?

options.text: Quotation marks
Apostrophes
Brackets
Parenthesis

questions.questionText: Which of the following punctuation marks is used in possessive nouns?

options.text: Quotation marks
Commas
Apostrophes
Semicolons

questions.questionText: Which of the following punctuation marks is used to separate two related, but independent clauses in a sentence?

options.text: A colon
A semicolon
A forward slash
A hyphen

questions.questionText: In which of the following sentences are commas used correctly?

options.text: There are many, other businesses, other than show business.
There are many other businesses, other than show business.
There are many other businesses other than show business. (no commas)
There, are many other businesses other than show business.

questions.questionText: In which of the following sentences are commas used correctly?

options.text: The president, who was just elected into office yesterday, has already left the country.
The president who was just elected into office yesterday, has already left the country.
The president who was just elected into office yesterday has already left the country. (no commas)
The president, who was just elected into office yesterday has already left the country.

questions.questionText: In which of the following sentences are commas used correctly?

options.text: There are the fruits, vegetables meats and dairy products in this aisle.
There are the fruits vegetables meats, and dairy products in this aisle.
There are the fruits, vegetables, meats, and dairy products in this aisle.
There are the fruits vegetables meats and dairy products in this aisle. (no commas)

questions.questionText: In which of the following sentences are commas used correctly?

options.text: I reminded him, for the third time to take the dog out for a walk.
I reminded him, for the third time, to take the dog out for a walk.
I reminded him for the third time, to take the dog out for a walk.
I reminded him for the third time to take the dog out for a walk. (no commas)

questions.questionText: In which of the following sentences are commas used correctly?

options.text: The final album of the band was recorded on March 23 1980.
The final album of the band was recorded on March, 23, 1980.
The final album of the band was recorded on March, 23 1980.
The final album of the band was recorded on March 23, 1980.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences should be connected with a semi-colon?

options.text: The company produces ___ computers, laptops, and monitors.
Their oldest son ___ Ted, will drive the guests of honor to the party.
You must be five feet tall to ride the roller coaster ___ therefore you cannot ride.
Do not mistake my cat ___ for the neighbor's cat because they look alike.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences should be connected with a semi-colon?

options.text: Because the Olympics will be held in my home country this year ___ I will attend.
There are many types of fish in the sea ___ there are also many types of birds in the sky.
The team is down on points ___ but can still win the game.
You will need to bring your ___ driver's license, social security card, and birth certificate.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences should be connected with a semi-colon?

options.text: We will be on the bus for a while ___ I will use this opportunity to read.
The noise from the other passengers ___ made it difficult to concentrate.
On a long road trip you need ___ books, music, and a pillow.
The destination ___ which is 300 miles away, will take 4 hours.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences should be connected with a colon?

options.text: The question still remains ___ to be investigated.
The scientist made a conclusion after years of research ___ the findings are inconclusive.
Science must constantly progress ___ in order for new discoveries to be made.
The answer was right in front of the scientist ___ however she failed to see it.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences should be connected with a colon?

options.text: Taking too many breaks while working on a project causes ___ the mind to lose focus more quickly than normal.
The tallest mountain I have ever successfully climbed was in Sparco ___ Illinois.
People look for desirable traits in their partners ___ health, income, personality, and emotional stability.
In my opinion ___ the city would be cleaner if there were more trash receptacles placed on street corners.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a complete sentence?

options.text: Left aligned or justified?
This report which Ed wrote.
This is my coat.
I for my birthday.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a complete sentence?

options.text: Can you help me?
This for me?
Several years ago, in May.
Notice of failure to comply with regulations.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a complete sentence?

options.text: And then, without notice he.
It is.
And so on.
For whom?

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a complete sentence?

options.text: Please return them to.
A generous offer and benefits package.
Thank you.
Excuse the.

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a complete sentence?

options.text: Endlessly dull, boring, and repetitive without any sign of relent.
Bring it to me.
Intended to see him someday.
Forgotten the place where it can be found.

questions.questionText:
Which of the following changes to the sentence fragment below would make it a complete sentence?

Filing reports for later retrieval.

options.text: David filing reports for later retrieval the next day.
I have been filing reports for later retrieval.
Filing reports for later retrieval well into the night.
The sentence is correct as is.

questions.questionText:
Which of the following changes to the sentence fragment below would make it a complete sentence?

Analyzing data.

options.text: Analyzing data for a meeting with Mr. Henderson.
Mary analyzing data in the back room.
We are analyzing data.
The sentence is correct as is.

questions.questionText:
Which of the following changes to the sentence fragment below would make it a complete sentence?

That was before the flood.

options.text: Before the flood and many years ago.
Found work before the flood.
What before the flood?
The sentence is correct as is.

questions.questionText:
The following sentence is a "run-on sentence." Which of the changes below would correct the problem?

My name is Bob, this is my story.

options.text: My name is Bob, and this is my story.
My name is Bob this is my story.
Bob is my name, this is my story.
The sentence is correct as is.

questions.questionText:
The following sentence is a "run-on sentence." Which of the changes below would correct the problem?

Hilary asked her coworkers to help her with her spreadsheet no one was willing.

options.text: Hilary asked her coworkers to help her with her spreadsheet, but no one was willing.
Hilary asked her coworkers to help her with her spreadsheet no one was willing.
Hilary asked her coworkers to help her with her spreadsheet, no one was willing.
The sentence is correct as is.

questions.questionText:
Fill in the blank with the correct plural or possessive form of the word.

The smallest _________ hiding place was between the fence and the garden.

options.text: bunnys
bunnies
bunny's
bunnies'

questions.questionText:
Fill in the blank with the correct plural or possessive form of the word.

Mastering the fine ______ takes years of practice.

options.text: art
arts
art's
arts'

questions.questionText:
Fill in the blank with the correct plural or possessive form of the word.

The board was filled with the history _________ lecture notes.

options.text: teacher
Teacher's
teacher's
teachers

questions.questionText:
Fill in the blank with the correct plural or possessive form of the word.

The _______ go into the storage unit.

options.text: boxes'
boxs
boxes
box's

questions.questionText:
Fill in the blank with the correct plural or possessive form of the word.

Sunset _______ courthouse is located in the middle of downtown.

options.text: City's
Cities
City
Cities

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences does NOT contain a misspelling or incorrectly used word?

options.text: Do not step on the neighbors lawn.
The rookie's batting average is 0.25 this year.
The best places to eat seafood is by the ocean.
Speeding tickets are a highest revenue generator.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences does NOT contain a misspelling or incorrectly used word?

options.text: The whether balloon was launched yesterday.
Hoover Dam provides electricity for much of Nevada.
Taking part in volunteer activities is a rewarded experience.
Dont eat the purple colored mushrooms.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences does NOT contain a misspelling or incorrectly used word?

options.text: Using live bait for fishing is more environmentally friendly than using chemicals.
We are going to spend the weekend at the beech surfing.
Go strait at the intersection and then make a left into the parking lot.
The top wrung of the ladder is the most unstable part of it.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences does NOT contain a misspelling or incorrectly used word?

options.text: Would you like a glass of whine with your dinner?
The breakfast serial contains more sugar than recommended.
There is no prophet in selling a product that nobody wants.
The books are due back to the library by Monday.

questions.questionText: Which of the following sentences does NOT contain a misspelling or incorrectly used word?

options.text: The roof sprung a leak last winter.
We are going to the state fare this year.
The stainless steal knife was very sharp.
Please weight for me by the front entrance.
